description: Follow text and radio commentary as Southern Brave host Northern Superchargers in the 2023 Women's Hundred.
title: The Hundred 2023 LIVE: Southern Brave vs Northern Superchargers in women's competition plus score, commentary, video highlights & updates
title_page: The Hundred 2023 LIVE: Southern Brave vs Northern Superchargers in women's competition plus score, commentary, video highlights & updates - BBC Sport
maintext:
Post
That's all from this live test as Southern Brave begin a busy day of Hundred action with a comfortable victory.
We will return at 14:15 for coverage of Oval Invincibles v Welsh Fire in the women's competition, plus updates from Southern Brave v Northern Superchargers in the men's.
See you there!
Post
Southern Brave captain Anya Shrubsole to Sky Sports: "Really pleased with the way we bounced back from Friday. We were really disappointed with the way we bowled in particular. It was a bit of a scrappy run chase but a win's a win.
"Lauren Bell set the tone with her first five balls. To two take two wickets and restrict their runs set the tone.
"I was pretty terrible on Friday. I was really disappointed with the way I bowled. But it was nice to be able to come here and put it right."
On Rhianna Southby: "I have been winding her up all day. It is like Rhianna Southby day. But she is an exceptional keeper and probably the second-best keeper in the country behind Amy Jones, so we are really happy to have her."
Post
Match Hero Southern Brave's Rhianna Southby: "It is amazing. I've not been anywhere near my best but to show people what I'm capable of is brilliant.
"It is tough. I spent a lot of time in the indoor school to try and get used to the low pitches that we've had.
"The catch to dismiss Alice Davidson-Richards was my favourite because under-edges are difficult to take because they go low."
Brave 71-1
Well, that's the last thing Superchargers needed.
A bouncer from Kate Cross leaps up off the surface, goes over the wicketkeeper's head and fizzes away for four byes.
It was also a no-ball as well so two more runs are added to the score plus a free hit, which only yields a single.
